content.title: WIfI Classification System
content.definition: The Wound, Ischemia, and foot Infection (WIfI) classification system is a threatened limb staging system that predicts major amputation risk and benefit from revascularization in patients with chronic limb-threatening ischemia (CLTI).

wound.grade_1: Small, shallow ulcer on distal leg or foot; no gangrene
wound.grade_2: Deeper ulcer with exposed bone/tendon or gangrene limited to digits
wound.grade_3: Extensive deep ulcer or gangrene involving forefoot/midfoot

foot_infection.grade_2: Moderate: local infection >2cm or deeper structures
foot_infection.grade_3: Severe: systemic signs (SIRS) or life/limb threatening

clinical_application.revascularization_benefit: Higher stages benefit more from intervention
clinical_application.wound_healing: Predicts likelihood of healing without/with revascularization
